title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker reveals new setting for the action in the sci-fi epic finale
text:
The story famously takes place 'A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away...' and moviegoers have enjoyed exploring said faraway galaxy for the past 40 years.

And with December's long-awaited release of the ninth episode of the Star Wars saga, Star Wars: The Rise Of Skywalker, fans of the franchise will get to explore even more corners of that beloved world.

One of those settings, seen in the briefest of glimpses in both this weekend's trailer as well as the first teaser for the film, now has an official name: 'the ocean moon Kef Bir,' as announced Wednesday on the Disney Parks Blog.

Quite the view: With December's long-awaited Star Wars: The Rise Of Skywalker, fans of the franchise will get to explore even more corners of that beloved world

In the trailers for the sci-fi epic, which brings the three Star Wars trilogies to an end, vistas of the remains of the Death Star are seen over a wide swath of angry ocean, which presumably marks Kef Bir's onscreen debut.

To refresh for the novices, the planet-like Death Star was destroyed from the nearby forest moon of Endor at the end of 1983's Return Of The Jedi, which served as the saga's sixth episode — 2015's The Force Awakens was the next chapter, followed by The Last Jedi in 2017. (The interim trilogy, which began with George Lucas's 1999 film The Phantom Menace, were the oft-criticized prequels starring Hayden Christensen.)

Disney Parks named the new planet in an announcement pertaining to Star Tours — The Adventures Continues, the popular ride in Disney's various theme parks, which will add a 'tour' of Kef Bir as part of that attraction to be timed with the release of the new film.

Trailblazer: One of those settings, seen in the briefest of glimpses in both this weekend's trailer as well as the first teaser for the film, now has an official name

Money shot: In the trailers for the latest Star Wars film, vistas of the remains of the Death Star are seen over a wide swath of angry ocean, which presumably marks the onscreen debut of ocean moon Kef Bir

While some fans suspected a return to the forest moon from the Return Of The Jedi in this final film due to glimpses of the downed Death Star, the fact that it's suspended over roiling ocean waves leads one to assume the action is in a different place altogether.

Other points in the latest trailer, however, might very well be on Endor's forest moon that was the home to the Ewoks: like at the beginning of the clip, when Rey (hero Daisy Ridley) is seen running through a forest.

It has yet to be revealed whether Kef Bir is a 'sibling moon' to the forest moon of Endor, but it does look promising that the two moons — one covered in water, the other in trees — might be complementary to one another.

Quick: Other brief shots are seen in this weekend's final trailer for the film, with a speeder hurtling over ocean waves toward the Death Star remains

In all its glory: The ocean moon Kef Bir

Return of the Ewoks? Other settings in the trailer may very well point to a return to the forest moon of Endor from 1983's Return Of The Jedi

Those wanting further details on Kef Bir will have to wait — Star Wars: The Rise Of Skywalker hits theaters on December 20th.

The film will feature some of the last footage of the late Carrie Fisher, who famously played Leia Organa.

On that same date, the new ocean moon destination will also be added to Star Tours at Disneyland Resort, Walt Disney World Resort, Tokyo Disneyland Park, as well as Disneyland Paris.

Showdown in the ruins: Those wanting further details on Kef Bir will have to wait til the movie's release
description: The story famously takes place 'A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away...' and moviegoers have enjoyed exploring said faraway galaxy for the past 40 years.
